ui

Class Connect4TextConsole

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.Connect4TextConsole
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, UI

    public class Connect4TextConsole
extends java.lang.Object
implements UI, java.lang.Runnable
    The text console ui class for the Connect4 game
    Version:
    2/9/20
    Author:
    Ryan Cluff, rpcluff, rpcluff@asu.edu

      The object representing the model of the game

      void displayBoard(int[][] board)
      Prints a representation of the board using pipe and space characters as well as the two icons specified by the game itself

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connect4TextConsole

        public Connect4TextConsole()
        Constructor for the text console. Initializes the game and scanner objects as well as prompts the user for 1p or 2p

        Returns:

      • getComputer

        public boolean getComputer()
        Description copied from interface: UI
        Prints a welcome message to the users and prompts whether the game will be 1 player or 2 player
        Specified by:
        getComputer in interface UI
        Returns:
        true if the player wants to play against a computer, false if against another player

      • main

        Main method for launching the text ui version of the game directly

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts the game. Continually loops asking for input for the game model until the game is over.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
